description: Construction of a third floor extension to provide one additional flat (a total of 7 flats) and reconfigure the three storey rear element on the secong floor to development approved under planning application reference PP/2015/1780 dated 01/07/2015 for change of use from part A3 (Use Class) and part C3 (Use Class) to part of 2 (Use Class) and part C3 (Use Class); extension of existing residential flat (four bed); construction of a part single, part three storey building towards the rear (following demolition of existing two storey building and rear extension) to accomodate an additional 6 flats)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Location Plan (1:1250), 101 Rev D, 102 Rev G, 103 Rev H, 104 Rev G, Design and Access Statement (Prepared by Spencer Architecture, March 2015).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| Samples of the exterior materials to be used shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority before the start of work on the site and only the approved materials shall be used.

Reason: In the interests of visual amenity. (Ealing Development Plan Document (2013) Policy 7.4 and 7B and Polcy 7.4 of the London Plan (2015). | The refuse and recycling storage facilities hereby approved shall be implemented and operational before the first occupation of any part of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage facilities to align with policy 5.17 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015) and standard 3.5.1 of the London Housing Design Guide.

| The cycle parking facilities hereby approved shall be implemented with 50% of the stands not requiring any lifting of cycles and to be operational before the first occupation of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015).

| The insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, which will achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms; and the insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the dwellings above shall not exceed the acoustic standard of NR 25 Leq 5mins, (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5mins, (one-third octaves) will be met inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq,5mins (octaves), 0r NR 25 Leq,5mins (one-third octaves), inside a living room when noise is generated from the commercial use.
The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of the future occupiers of property, in accordance with policy 7b of the adopted Ealing Development Plan Document and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 "Noise and Vibration". | The rating noise level emitted from the external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, will not exceed the existing background sound level, as measured at the nearest noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of the future occupiers of property, in accordance with policy 7b of the adopted Ealing Development Plan Document and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015). | The hours of business for the Class A2 use of the building shall be restricted to the period [0800 - 1800hrs] Monday to Saturday.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of the future occupiers of property, in accordance with policy 7b of the adopted Ealing Development Plan Document and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015). | Deliveries of goods to, and waste collections from the proposed development shall only take place during the period 0800 - 1800 hrs on Mondays to Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public Holidays.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of the future occupiers of property, in accordance with policy 7b of the adopted Ealing Development Plan Document and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015).
